meanings.definition: A person or thing that knocks.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was the best knockers in the game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent2: The knockers on the door were loud and clear, announcing the arrival of a visitor.
meanings.sent3: The knockers on the door seemed to have a mind of their own, tapping away at odd times.
meanings.sent4: Her knockers on the door echoed through the empty hallway, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The knockers on the door were so rusty that they squeaked with every tap.

meanings.definition: A pair of metal rings or handles on a door that can be used for knocking.
meanings.sent1: The shiny knockers on the front door added a touch of elegance to the house.
meanings.sent2: She gripped the knockers firmly and rapped on the door to get the attention of the residents.
meanings.sent3: The knockers on the door gleamed in the sunlight, almost like they were winking at passersby.
meanings.sent4: The knockers on the door were like guardians, protecting the house from unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle touch, she used the knockers on the door to announce her presence.

meanings.sent1: She felt self-conscious about her knockers, always trying to hide them under loose clothing.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover featured a model with perfectly shaped knockers, setting unrealistic beauty standards.
meanings.sent3: She joked with her friends about her knockers, making light of societal beauty norms.
meanings.sent4: In the mirror, she admired her knockers, appreciating their natural curves and uniqueness.
meanings.sent5: The dress accentuated her knockers, drawing attention to her feminine silhouette.
